intro: Leandra choetodon, commonly known as the golden leandra, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, showy yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and have a smooth, waxy texture. Leandra choetodon thrives in humid, well-drained soils and requires partial to full sunlight for optimal growth.
